unnormalised: Indian Railways, the lifeline of India, eh? Gotta love the chaos and the charm! Planning a trip? Here's the lowdown. First off, book those tickets EARLY, like months in advance if you're traveling during Diwali or Holi. IRCTC's website is your best friend (or worst enemy, depending on your luck). Remember Tatkal bookings open at 10:00 AM for AC classes and 11:00 AM for non-AC. Set those alarms, folks!
normalised: Indian Railways, the lifeline of India, eh? Gotta love the chaos and the charm! Planning a trip? Here's the lowdown. First off, book those tickets early, like months in advance if you're traveling during Diwali or Holi. I-R-C-T-C's website is your best friend (or worst enemy, depending on your luck). Remember Tatkal bookings open at ten A-M for A-C classes and eleven A-M for non-A-C. Set those alarms, folks!

unnormalised: Now, class matters. 3AC is generally a good balance between comfort and cost. 2AC gives you more space, and 1AC is practically a hotel room (well, almost!). Sleeper class is the real Indian experience, though. Get ready to share space, stories, and maybe even some snacks with your co-passengers. Just a heads up, vendors shouting "Chai garam!" and "Vada Pav!" will be a constant. Don't forget to haggle the prices!

unnormalised: Food, you ask? Train food can be… questionable. Pack some snacks, like biscuits or namkeen, just in case. You can also order food online through apps like RailRestro; they deliver right to your seat at certain stations. Keep an eye out for the "pantry car" - it's like a rolling cafeteria. Also, most of the trains have e-catering. You can order your fav meals from Dominos, Mc Donalds, etc.

unnormalised: As for travel, apps like "Where is my train?" are lifesavers. They give you real-time location updates, even if the train is running late (which it probably will be). And remember to check your PNR status on the IRCTC site. Platform numbers are usually announced like 30 mins before arrival. Make sure you pre-pone your travel plans a bit, 'cause trains sometimes arrive before the mentioned time.

unnormalised: Finally, keep your belongings safe! Petty theft is unfortunately common. Also, don't forget to take a picture of your ticket. Download the UTS app on your phone, in case you have to take the unreserved tickets (especially in local trains). Have an amazing journey on the Indian Railways! It's an experience like no other, even with all its quirks. Namaste!
